definition: Big Mac hamburger (Tw) (old)/now referred to (in Taiwan) as 大麥克|大麦克[Da4 Mai4 ke4]
fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]
an earthwork/castle/position of defense/stronghold/used in place names, often as phonetic bao for "burg" or "bad"
variant of 鋪|铺[pu4]/used in place names

sentences.english: I want a Big Mac and small fries.
sentences.chinese: 我要一個麥香堡和一包小薯。

sentences.english: Can I have a BigMac Combo and a twenty-piece chicken nuggets?
sentences.chinese: 我想要一份麥香堡套餐和一份20塊雞塊。

sentences.english: I want a Big Mac and some milk, please.
sentences.chinese: 請給我大的麥香堡和一些牛奶。
